node.title: Ali's glove, Bradman's bat and Schumacher's hat up for auction in Ipswich council sell-off
node.alt: Signed boxing glove of Muhammad Ali in a frame, held at Ipswich City Council.
node.description: A disgraced former council used ratepayer funds to buy Muhammad Ali's gloves, Don Bradman's cricket bat and a trove of other sporting treasures. NowÂ it's all up for grabs in a public auction.
node.content:
["The vault at the Ipswich City Council chambers, west of Brisbane, looks more like a museum than a storeroom, with a framed boxing glove signed by\u00a0Muhammad Ali displayed next to a tennis racket signed by Ash Barty.", "Next to that is a collection of poems and paintings detailing an Ipswich from decades ago.\u00a0", "The city they describe is almost unrecognisable to the one that stands today.", "As Queensland's fastest-growing local government area,\u00a0Ipswich has metamorphosed\u00a0in the years since the artworks were created.\u00a0", "Perhaps the most notable part of that metamorphosis is the council responsible for this surfeit of treasures being totally disbanded over corruption, fraud and misconduct findings in 2018.", "Part of that involved the use of money from the council's charitable donations fund to purchase pieces at charity auctions.", "Those items are the ones now held in the council vault: 191 pieces of sporting memorabilia worth upwards of $53,000 and some 200 other items including fine wines\u00a0and historical relics.", "", "
A tennis racquet signed by world champion Ash Barty is up for sale.(ABC News: Tobias Jurss-Lewis)
", "Today, the items go under the hammer as the new council, led by Mayor Teresa Harding, attempts to rebuild the trust of its constituents.", "\"All the money that's recouped will go back to the community as part of a community development grant,\" Ms Harding said.", "\"Many items were purchased using ratepayers' money.\u00a0Since the ratepayers' money was used to purchase these items, it's only right that money goes back to the community.\"", "", "
Mayor Teresa\u00a0Harding says the new council worked with the CCC\u00a0to track down and catalogue the items.(ABC News: Rachel McGhee)
", "
What's on offer?
", "Premier\u00a0pieces in the collection include a hat once owned by Michael Schumacher, a cricket bat signed by\u00a0Donald Bradman, the tennis racket signed by Barty, and Ali's signed boxing glove.", "A set of number plates personalised with the word \"Ipswich\" are also on offer.", "", "
A premier\u00a0piece\u00a0in the collection is a hat signed by F1 champion Michael Schumacher.(ABC News: Tobias Jurss-Lewis)
", "\"There's a lot of great artwork there \u2014\u00a0little sculptures and ornaments, a lot of really interesting things,\" Ms\u00a0Harding said.", "Many of the items are believed to have been purchased by the previous council at auctions around Ipswich, while others were donated by community groups during\u00a0former mayor Paul Pisasale's 13-year reign.", "Ms Harding said the council had worked with the Crime and Corruption Commission (CCC) to track down and catalogue the items in the three years since the Pisasale administration was disbanded.", "\"That process of \u2026 bringing the items together started under an interim administration,\" she said.", "\"The paperwork wasn't great \u2026\u00a0there were items all over council, there were some in councillors' homes that were returned, also with some of the community groups as well.\"", "For the past month, residents have been able to browse an online catalogue and submit claims for items they or their family have owned or donated.", "\"We've had a really open and transparent process with this \u2026\u00a0anyone who believes they own these items has\u00a0been able to approach us,\" Ms\u00a0Harding said.", "", "
A set of personalised \"Ipswich\" number plates are also on offer.(ABC News: Tobias Jurss-Lewis)
", "Pisasale has submitted claims for 120 items, including artwork and coffee cups,\u00a0that form part of his world-record collection of demitasses.", "Thirteen other people\u00a0have also submitted claims for items.", "", "
Some of the coffee cups collected by former\u00a0Ipswich mayor Paul Pisasale.(ABC News: Courtney Wilson)
", "A donation event will also be held on December 13 and 14 to allow community groups and not-for-profit organisations to claim items that were seized by the council but deemed not suitable for auction.", "", "
This cricket bat signed by Don Bradman is another item available in\u00a0the auction.(ABC News: Tobias Jurss-Lewis)
"]
